It means that the knowledge of accumulation has already arisen, but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen.
Regarding the dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering and accumulation,
and regarding the dharmas not associated with the view of cessation and path to be eliminated by seeing in the form and formless realms,
and regarding the dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the form and formless realms, there is no bondage of the two fetters.
The knowledge of cessation has already arisen, but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen.
Regarding the dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering, accumulation, and cessation,
and regarding the dharmas not associated with the view of the path to be eliminated by seeing in the form and formless realms,
and regarding the dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the form and formless realms, there is no bondage of the two fetters.

The fully seeing BhagavÄn's disciples,ğŸ”½who have not yet eliminated the defilements of desire, have no bondage of the two fetters regarding the dharmas to be eliminated by seeing and the dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the form and formless realms.
Those who have already eliminated the defilements of desire have no bondage of the two fetters regarding the dharmas of the desire realm.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
Those who have already separated from attachment to the form realm are not bound by two fetters to dharmas of the desire and form realms.
Those who have already separated from attachment to the formless realm are not bound by two fetters to dharmas of the three realms.
Here, all dharmas that bind and those that are bound have already been severed, so they are all free from two fetters.
This is because both the fetter of anger and the fetter of views are both severed.
Question: In the desire realm there is anger.
When one obtains freedom from the fetter of anger, one can be said to be unfettered.
The form and formless realms are originally without the fetter of anger.
How can it be said that they are unfettered by the fetter of anger?
Answer: There are two kinds of unfettered: the first is obtaining unfetteredness from being fettered;
the second is originally unfettered by nature.
Therefore it is called unfettered.
Because dharmas of the desire realm have the fetter of anger,
when one attains liberation, it is said that one obtains unfetteredness from being fettered.
Dharmas of the upper two realms are originally without the fetter of anger.
Therefore it is said that they are originally unfettered by nature.
Because the word unfettered includes both meanings, it is said here that they are both unfettered.
As the Vinaya says there are two kinds of pudgalas.
They are called pure.
The first is one who originally does not violate the precepts.
The second is one who, having violated them, repents according to the Dharma.
The first is called pure because of being originally undefiled.
The second is called pure because of attaining purity from defilement.
Unrestrained is also like this.
Therefore there is no error.
Question: What are the dharmas dissociated from the view-fetters abandoned by seeing cessation and the path in the form and formless realms?

Answer: Those with the nature of wrong views, those associated with the aggregates of views, attachment to precepts and vows, doubt, craving, pride, and unique ignorance, and the dharmas associated and not associated with them.
The associated dharmas are:
The mental and mental factors in the aggregates of wrong views, attachment to views, up to unique ignorance.
The dissociated dharmas are:
In the aggregates of wrong views, up to unique ignorance,
The four characteristics and the characteristics of the aggregates of attainment.
As with the view-fetters,
The same applies to the doubt fetter.
That is to say, just as the view fetter extends to the three realms and is only of four categories,
it has both contaminated and uncontaminated objects, and is both omnipresent and not omnipresent.
The doubt fetter is also like this.
Therefore, if the anger fetter is compared to the doubt fetter, it is the same as comparing it to the view fetter.
If there is bondage by the anger fetter in a certain thing, is there also bondage by the grasping fetter?
The answer is: Four sentences should be made.
Here, the anger fetter is only in the desire realm and extends to the five categories.
It only has contaminated objects and is not omnipresent.
The grasping fetter extends to the three realms and is only of four categories. It has contaminated objects and extends to both omnipresent and not omnipresent.
Those who are fully bound have bondage by the anger fetter in the five categories of things in the desire realm, and also have bondage by the grasping fetter.
If there is bondage by the grasping fetter, there is also bondage by the anger fetter.
In the five categories of things in the form and formless realms,
there is bondage by the grasping fetter but no bondage by the anger fetter.
For those who are not fully bound, the anger fetter is only in the desire realm and is not omnipresent, so it is short.
Because it extends to the five categories, it is long.
The fetter of grasping is only four parts, so it is short.
It is long because it is universal and non-universal in the three realms.
These two have the meaning of being long and short in turn.
The question should be answered in four sentences.
There may be one who is bound by the fetter of anger but not by the fetter of grasping.
Namely, one who has not yet eliminated the defilements of the desire realm.
The cognition of accumulation has already arisen, but the cognition of cessation has not yet arisen.
With regard to the dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm, the fetter of anger has not yet been eliminated.
The cognition of cessation has already arisen, but the cognition of the path has not yet arisen.
With regard to the dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm, the fetter of anger has not yet been eliminated.
The fully seeing disciples of the World-Honored One.

Those who have not yet eliminated the defilements of the desire realm have the fetter of anger that has not yet been eliminated with regard to the dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm.
Among them, there may be nine grades of the fetter of anger that have not yet been eliminated.
Up to there may be one grade of the fetter of anger that has not yet been eliminated.
Because it has not yet been eliminated, there is the fetter of anger but not the fetter of grasping.
Why is it so?
Because the universal fetter of grasping that takes the five categories as objects has already been eliminated.
Because the fetter of grasping that is not a pervasive fetter cannot bind those that are abandoned by cultivation, whether they have been severed or not.
Because the class of those that are abandoned by cultivation has no fetter of grasping.
There may be one who is bound by the fetter of grasping but not bound by the fetter of anger.
This refers to one who has not yet eliminated the passion of the desire realm.
When the cognition of suffering has already arisen but the cognition of accumulation has not yet arisen,
with regard to dharmas abandoned by the vision of suffering in the desire realm,
the fetter of grasping that is abandoned by the vision of accumulation has not yet been severed.
With regard to dharmas in the form and formless realms, the fetter of grasping has not yet been severed.
Here, one who has not yet eliminated the passion of the desire realm,
when the cognition of suffering has already arisen but the cognition of accumulation has not yet arisen,
the fetter of anger and the fetter of grasping that are abandoned by the vision of suffering in the desire realm have both already been severed.
Because the fetter of grasping that is abandoned by the vision of accumulation in the desire realm has not yet been severed.
With regard to dharmas abandoned by the vision of suffering in the desire realm, it is a binding as an object.

Although the fetter of anger that is abandoned by the vision of accumulation in the desire realm has not yet been severed, with regard to dharmas abandoned by the vision of suffering in the desire realm,ğŸ”½it is not a binding as an object because it is not a pervasive fetter.
It is not a binding as association because it belongs to a different aggregate.
In the form and formless realms, there are those who have not yet eliminated the fetter of grasping.
Some have not yet eliminated the fetter of grasping in eight stages,
up to some who have not yet eliminated the fetter of grasping in one stage.
Within this stage, some have not yet eliminated the fetter of grasping in four parts,
up to some who have not yet eliminated the fetter of grasping in one part.
Because they have not yet eliminated it, they are bound by the fetter of grasping but not by the fetter of anger.
Because they are without anger.
Some are bound by both.
Those who are fully bound are bound by two fetters in the desire realm with respect to dharmas that are eliminated by seeing and cultivation.
Here, those who are fully bound are bound by one part of the fetter of anger and two parts of the fetter of grasping with respect to dharmas eliminated by seeing suffering in the desire realm.
It is the same with respect to dharmas eliminated by seeing the accumulation in the desire realm.
With respect to dharmas eliminated by seeing cessation in the desire realm,
they are bound by one part of the fetter of anger and three parts of the fetter of grasping.
It is the same with respect to dharmas eliminated by seeing the path in the desire realm.
Regarding dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm, there is one part of the enmityç»“ that binds, and two parts of the graspingç»“ that bind.
Next, those who have not yet eliminated desire realm attachment,
when the knowledge of suffering has arisen but the knowledge of accumulation has not yet arisen,
regarding dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the accumulation, cessation, path, and cultivation in the desire realm, there are twoç»“ that bind.
Among them, regarding dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the accumulation in the desire realm,
there is one part of the enmityç»“ that binds, and one part of the graspingç»“ that binds.
Regarding dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the cessation and path in the desire realm,
each has one part of the enmityç»“ that binds, and two parts of the graspingç»“ that bind.
Regarding dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm,
there is one part of the enmityç»“ that binds, and one part of the graspingç»“ that binds.
At that time, regarding dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering in the desire realm,
although there is the graspingç»“ that binds, there is no enmityç»“ that binds.
Therefore, this is not mentioned.
Next, when the knowledge of accumulation has arisen but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen,
regarding dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the cessation and path in the desire realm, there are twoç»“ that bind.
Among them, those who have not yet eliminated desire realm attachment,
In the desire realm, in relation to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing cessation and the path,
there is one category of the fetter of anger and one category of the fetter of grasping.
At that time, in the desire realm, in relation to dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation,
although there is the fetter of anger, there is no fetter of grasping.
Therefore this is not mentioned.
Next, when the knowledge of cessation has arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen,
in the desire realm, in relation to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the path, there are two fetters.
Here, one has not yet become free from the desire realm.
In relation to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the path,
there is one category of the fetter of anger and one category of the fetter of grasping.
At that time, in the desire realm, in relation to dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation,
although there is the fetter of anger, there is no fetter of grasping.
Therefore this is not mentioned.
Next, there are some who are not bound by either.
Namely, those who have not yet become free from the desire realm,
when the knowledge of accumulation has arisen but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen,
in relation to dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering and accumulation,
and in relation to dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the form and formless realms, there are no two fetters.
When the knowledge of cessation has arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen,
In the case of dharmas to be eliminated by seeing suffering, origination, and cessation,
and in the case of dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the form and formless realms, there is no bondage of two fetters.
The fully awakened disciple of the World-Honored One,
who has not yet eliminated the defilements of desire,
in the case of dharmas to be eliminated by seeing,
and in the case of dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation in the form and formless realms, there is no bondage of two fetters.
Having already eliminated the defilements of desire, in the case of dharmas of the desire realm there is no bondage of two fetters.
Having already eliminated the defilements of form, in the case of dharmas of the desire and form realms there is no bondage of two fetters.
Having already eliminated the defilements of the formless, in the case of dharmas of the three realms there is no bondage of two fetters.
Here, the dharmas that bind and that which is bound have both been eliminated, so all are free from two fetters.
This is because the fetters of anger and grasping are both eliminated.
If there is bondage of the fetter of anger towards a certain thing, is there also bondage of the fetter of jealousy?
Answer: If there is bondage of the fetter of jealousy,
there must be bondage of the fetter of anger.
There may be bondage of the fetter of anger without bondage of the fetter of jealousy.
This refers to the case where the fetter of anger towards dharmas to be eliminated by seeing in the desire realm has not yet been eliminated.
Here, the fetter of ill-will is only in the desire realm and is common to the five categories.
It only has impure objects and is not universal. The fetter of jealousy is only in the desire realm and is eliminated by cultivation. It has impure objects and is not universal.
Those who are fully bound, with regard to the objects eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm,
if there is the fetter of ill-will, there is also the fetter of jealousy.
If there is the fetter of jealousy,
there is also the fetter of ill-will. With regard to the objects eliminated by insight in the desire realm,
there is the fetter of ill-will but not the fetter of jealousy.
Those who are not fully bound, if they have not yet eliminated the desire realm attachment,
with regard to the objects eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm, they are bound by both fetters.
With regard to the objects eliminated by insight in the desire realm, where they have not yet been eliminated, there is the fetter of ill-will but not the fetter of jealousy.
Where they have already been eliminated, there are no two fetters.
If they have already eliminated the desire realm attachment, with regard to the five categories of objects in the desire realm, there are no two fetters.
With regard to the five categories of objects in the form and formless realms,
whether fully bound or not fully bound, at all times there are no two fetters.
This is because the fetter of ill-will is longer and the fetter of jealousy is shorter.
The question should be answered according to the latter clause.
If there is a fetter of envy on this object, there must be a fetter of hatred.
That is, on the objects not yet abandoned by cultivation in the desire realm.
There may be a fetter of hatred without a fetter of envy.
That is, on the dharmas abandoned by insight in the desire realm, where the fetter of hatred has not yet been eliminated.
Here, there may be four parts of the fetter of hatred not yet eliminated,
up to there may be one part of the fetter of hatred not yet eliminated.
Because it has not yet been eliminated, there is a fetter of hatred but no fetter of envy.
Why is this?
Because the part abandoned by insight is devoid of the fetter of envy.ğŸ”½As with the fetter of envy,
it is the same with the fetter of stinginess.
That is, envy and stinginess are both abandoned by cultivation in the desire realm, have impure objects, and are not universal.
If there is a fetter of ignorance on this object, is there also a fetter of views?
The answer is: If there is a fetter of views on this object, there must be a fetter of ignorance.
There may be a fetter of ignorance without a fetter of views.
And so on, explaining in detail.
Here, the fetter of ignorance pervades the three realms and the five categories, with contaminated and uncontaminated objects, as well as pervasive and non-pervasive [mental factors].
The fetter of views pervades the three realms and only the four categories, with contaminated and uncontaminated objects, as well as pervasive and non-pervasive [mental factors].
Those who are fully bound, with regard to the five categories of objects in the three realms,
if there is the fetter of ignorance, there is also the fetter of views.
If there is the fetter of views, there is also the fetter of ignorance.
Those who are not fully bound have a long fetter of ignorance and a short fetter of views.
The question should be answered in accordance with the latter statement.
If there is the fetter of views on a certain object, there must be the fetter of ignorance.
This refers to objects in the three realms and five categories where the fetter of views has not yet been severed.
There may be the fetter of ignorance but not the fetter of views.
This refers to when the knowledge of the origin [of suffering] has arisen but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen,
with regard to dharmas not associated with the fetter of views that are to be eliminated by the path of cessation and the path of the spiritual path,
and where the fetter of ignorance has not yet been severed with regard to dharmas to be eliminated by the spiritual path.

Here, the dharmas not associated with the view-fetters abandoned by the paths of seeing cessation and the path are the essence of that wrong view, and the aggregates associated with and not associated with the view of holding to an extreme, the view of grasping extremes, doubt, craving, hatred, pride, and the unique ignorance.
Because the fetter of ignorance has not yet been severed regarding these dharmas, there is the bondage of the fetter of ignorance.
Regarding their own aggregates, there is bondage as object and bondage as association.
If regarding other aggregates, there is bondage as object but not bondage as association. There is no bondage of the view-fetters.
Why is this?

Because the pervasive view-fetters that take the five categories as objects have already been severed.ğŸ”½The remaining ones that have not yet been severed are not the objects of bondage of the view-fetters that are not associated with the view-fetters.ğŸ”½Because they are not the objects of bondage of the fetter of ignorance that takes the pure as its object.

Because they are not the objects of bondage of the fetter of ignorance that takes the pure as its object.ğŸ”½Because they are not the objects of bondage of the fetter of ignorance that takes the pure as its object.ğŸ”½Because they are not the objects of bondage of the fetter of ignorance that takes the pure as its object.ğŸ”½Because they are not the objects of bondage of the fetter of ignorance that takes the pure as its object.ğŸ”½Because they are not the objects of bondage of the fetter of ignorance that takes the pure as its object.ğŸ”½Because they are not the objects of bondage of the fetter of ignorance that takes the pure as its object.ğŸ”½Because they are not the objects of bondage of the fetter of ignorance that takes the pure as its object.ğŸ”½Because they are not the objects of bondage of the fetter of ignorance that takes the pure as its object.ğŸ”½Because they are not the objects of bondage of the fetter of ignorance that takes the pure as its object.ğŸ”½Because they are not the objects of bondage of the fetter of ignorance that takes the pure as its object.ğŸ”½Because they are not the objects of bondage of the fetter of ignorance that takes the pure as its object.

In this stage, there may be nine grades of ignorance bonds that have not yet been severed,
up to there may be one grade of ignorance bonds that have not yet been severed, but no view bonds are bound.
Why is this?
Because the omnipresent view bonds that take the five categories as objects
have already been severed.
Because there are no view bonds to be severed by cultivation.
Furthermore, when the knowledge of cessation has arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen,
with regard to the dharmas that are not associated with the view bonds to be severed by the path of insight,
and with regard to the dharmas to be severed by cultivation, there is ignorance bond that has not yet been severed.
Among them, the dharmas to be severed by the path of insight that are not associated with the view bonds are as explained above.
With regard to these dharmas and the dharmas to be severed by cultivation, there is ignorance bond that binds, but no view bond that binds, as explained above.
Furthermore, the World-Honored Buddha who possesses insight,
with regard to the dharmas to be severed by cultivation, there is ignorance bond that has not yet been severed.
Among them, there may be nine stages of ignorance bonds that have not yet been severed,
up to there may be one stage of ignorance bonds that have not yet been severed.
In this stage, there may be nine grades of ignorance bonds that have not yet been severed,
up to there may be one grade of ignorance bonds that have not yet been severed.
Because they have not yet been severed, there are bonds of ignorance but no bonds of views.
Why is this?
Because all bonds of views have already been severed by them.
As with the bonds of views,
the bonds of doubt are also the same.

That is to say, just as the bonds of views are found in the three realms and are only of four categories, and are both with outflows and without outflows, and have universal objects and non-universal objects,
the bonds of doubt are also the same.
Therefore, if the bonds of ignorance are compared to the bonds of doubt, they are the same as compared to the bonds of views.
If there are bonds of ignorance with regard to a certain thing, are there also bonds of grasping with regard to it?
The answer is: If there are bonds of grasping with regard to a certain thing,
there must be bonds of ignorance with regard to it.
There may be bonds of ignorance,
but no bonds of grasping.
And so on, it is explained in detail.
Here, the bonds of ignorance are found in the three realms and in the five categories, and have both outflows and no outflows, and have universal objects and non-universal objects.
The fetter of grasping is found in all three realms and is only associated with the four mental aggregates. It has two types of objects: contaminated objects and universal and non-universal objects.

The fetter of grasping is found in the three realms and is only associated with the four categories. It has two types of objects: contaminated objects and both omnipresent and non-omnipresent objects.ğŸ”½Those who are bound by all fetters
if they are bound by the fetter of ignorance, they are also bound by the fetter of grasping.
If they are bound by the fetter of grasping, they are also bound by the fetter of ignorance.
Those who are not bound by all fetters have a long fetter of ignorance but a short fetter of grasping.
Therefore, the question should be answered in accordance with the latter statement.
If there is a fetter of grasping bound to a thing, there must also be a fetter of ignorance bound to it.
This refers to things in the three realms and five categories where the fetter of grasping has not yet been eliminated.
There may be a fetter of ignorance bound to it but no fetter of grasping bound to it.
This refers to when the knowledge of accumulation has arisen but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen.
There is a fetter of ignorance that has not yet been eliminated regarding dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation.
When the knowledge of cessation has arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen,
there is a fetter of ignorance that has not yet been eliminated regarding dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation.
The fully seeing BhagavÄn's disciples
have a fetter of ignorance that has not yet been eliminated regarding dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation.
Here, there may be nine grounds of ignorance bonds that have not yet been severed,
up to there may be one ground of ignorance bonds that have not yet been severed.
Within this ground, there may be nine grades of ignorance bonds that have not yet been severed,
up to there may be one grade of ignorance bonds that have not yet been severed.
Because they have not yet been severed, there are bonds of ignorance and bonds of grasping.
Why is this?

The all-pervading grasping bonds that take the five categories as objects have already been severed.ğŸ”½The non-pervading grasping bonds that have not yet been severed have already been severed, because they cannot bind the dharmas to be severed through cultivation.
Because there are no grasping bonds in the category of dharmas to be severed through cultivation.
If there are bonds of ignorance with regard to this matter, are there also bonds of jealousy?
The answer is: If there are bonds of jealousy with regard to this matter, there must be bonds of ignorance.
There may be bonds of ignorance without bonds of jealousy.
Namely, with regard to the dharmas to be severed through the path of seeing in the desire realm,
and with regard to the dharmas in the form and formless realms, there may be bonds of ignorance that have not yet been severed.
Here, the fetter of ignorance pervades the three realms and the five categories, and has as its objects both contaminated and uncontaminated dharmas, and both universal and non-universal dharmas.
The fetter of envy is only in the desire realm, is eliminated by cultivation, has as its objects contaminated dharmas, and is not universal.
Those who are completely bound, with regard to the objects eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm,ğŸ”½if they are bound by the fetter of ignorance, they are also bound by the fetter of envy.
If they are bound by the fetter of envy, they are also bound by the fetter of ignorance.
With regard to the four categories of objects eliminated by the path of seeing in the desire realm,
and the five categories of objects in the form and formless realms,
they are bound by the fetter of ignorance but not by the fetter of envy.
Those who are not completely bound, if they have not yet abandoned the desire realm,
with regard to the objects eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm, they are bound by both fetters.
With regard to the four categories of objects eliminated by the path of seeing in the three realms,
in places where they have not yet abandoned the bonds, they are bound by the fetter of ignorance but not by the fetter of envy.
In places where they have already abandoned the bonds, they are not bound by either fetter.
With regard to the objects eliminated by cultivation in the form and formless realms,
they are bound by the fetter of ignorance but not by the fetter of envy.
Those who have already separated from the desire realm's defilements have no two fetters binding them to the five types of objects in the desire realm.
As for the five types of objects in the form and formless realms,
according to the places where they are not yet separated from,
there is the fetter of ignorance binding them, but no fetter of jealousy binding them.
If they are already separated from, there are no two fetters binding them.
This is because the fetter of ignorance is long, while the fetter of jealousy is short.
The question should be answered in accordance with the latter phrase.
If there is the fetter of jealousy binding to this object, there must be the fetter of ignorance binding.
This refers to the objects in the desire realm that are to be eliminated by cultivation and are not yet separated from.
There may be the fetter of ignorance binding,
but no fetter of jealousy binding.

This refers to the dharmas to be eliminated by the path of seeing in the desire realm, where the fetter of ignorance has not yet been eliminated. Here, there may be four types of the fetter of ignorance that have not yet been eliminated,
up to there may be one type of the fetter of ignorance that has not yet been eliminated.
As for the dharmas in the form and formless realms, the fetter of ignorance has not yet been eliminated.
Here, there may be eight levels of the fetter of ignorance that have not yet been eliminated,
up to there may be one level of the fetter of ignorance that has not yet been eliminated.
In this stage, there may be five types of ignorance bonds that have not yet been severed.
Up to there may be one type of ignorance bond that has not yet been severed.
Within this type, there may be nine grades of ignorance bonds that have not yet been severed.
Up to there may be one grade of ignorance bonds that have not yet been severed.
Due to not yet being severed, there are bonds of ignorance and bonds of jealousy.
Why is this?
Because the category of that which is severed by insight is devoid of the bonds of jealousy.
The form and formless realms are also devoid of jealousy.
As with the bonds of jealousy,
the bonds of stinginess are also so.
This is because jealousy and stinginess are both only in the desire realm, severed by cultivation, have contaminated objects, and are not universal.
If there are bonds of view with regard to this thing, are there also bonds of grasping?
The answer is: If there are bonds of view with regard to this thing, there must be bonds of grasping.
There may be bonds of grasping without bonds of view.
And so on, explaining in detail.

Among these, the view fetter is found in the three realms and is only associated with the four categories, having both contaminated and uncontaminated objects, and is both omnipresent and not omnipresent.
The grasping fetter is found in the three realms and is only associated with the four categories, having only contaminated objects, and is both omnipresent and not omnipresent.
Those who are fully bound to the three realms and five categories of objects,
if they are bound by the view fetter, they are also bound by the grasping fetter.
If they are bound by the grasping fetter, they are also bound by the view fetter.
Those who are not fully bound may have the view fetter not associated with the objects abandoned by the paths of seeing and cultivation,
but have the grasping fetter bound, and do not have the view fetter bound.
This is because the view fetter is shorter and the grasping fetter is longer.
The question should be answered in accordance with the preceding statement.
If there is a view fetter bound to this object, there must be a grasping fetter bound.
This refers to the objects bound by the view fetter in the three realms and five categories that have not yet been abandoned.
There may be a grasping fetter bound but not a view fetter.
This refers to when the knowledge of accumulation has arisen but the knowledge of cessation has not yet arisen,
and the grasping fetter has not yet been abandoned in the objects not associated with the view fetter that are abandoned by the paths of seeing and cultivation.
When the knowledge of cessation has already arisen but the knowledge of the path has not yet arisen,
in the dharmas not associated with the view-fetter that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing, the fetter of grasping is not yet eliminated.
Among them, the dharmas not associated with the view-fetter that are to be eliminated by the path of cessation and the path of cultivation are as explained above.
Because the fetter of grasping is not yet eliminated in these dharmas, there is bondage by the fetter of grasping.
They are bound by the fetter of grasping in their own aggregates as the object of perception and as association.
If they are bound by the fetter of grasping in other aggregates as the object of perception, they are not bound by association. There is no bondage by the view-fetter.
Why is this?
Because the pervasive view-fetter that takes the five categories as its object has already been eliminated.
The remaining uneliminated [fetters] are not bound as the object of perception in the dharmas not associated with the view-fetter. Because they have pure objects as their object.
They are not bound by association. Because they belong to other aggregates.
Because the intrinsic nature is not associated with the intrinsic nature.
If there is bondage by the view-fetter in this matter, is there also bondage by the doubt-fetter?
The answer is: Four sentences should be made.

Among these, the view fetter extends to the three realms and only to the four categories, and it has both contaminated and uncontaminated objects, as well as both universal and non-universal [objects].
